verses.verse: And the LORD<WH3068> spake<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, saying<WH559>,
This month<WH2320> shall be unto you the beginning<WH7218> of months<WH2320>: it shall be the first<WH7223> month<WH2320> of the year<WH8141> to you.

Speak<WH1696> ye unto all the congregation<WH5712> of Israel<WH3478>, saying<WH559>, In the tenth<WH6218> day of this month<WH2320> they shall take<WH3947> to them every man<WH376> a lamb<WH7716>, according to the house<WH1004> of their fathers<WH1>, a lamb<WH7716> for an house<WH1004>: lamb: or, kid

And if the household<WH1004> be<WH1961> too little<WH4591> for the lamb<WH7716>, let him and his neighbour<WH7934> next<WH7138> unto his house<WH1004> take<WH3947> it according to the number<WH4373> of the souls<WH5315>; every man<WH376> according<WH6310> to his eating<WH400> shall make your count<WH3699> for the lamb<WH7716>.

Your lamb<WH7716> shall be without blemish<WH8549>, a male<WH2145> of the first<WH1121> year<WH8141>: ye shall take<WH3947> it out from the sheep<WH3532>, or from the goats<WH5795>: of: Heb. son of a year

And ye shall keep<WH4931> it up until the fourteenth<WH702> <WH6240> day<WH3117> of the same month<WH2320>: and the whole<WH3605> assembly<WH6951> of the congregation<WH5712> of Israel<WH3478> shall kill<WH7819> it in<WH996> the evening<WH6153>. in: Heb. between the two evenings

And they shall take<WH3947> of the blood<WH1818>, and strike<WH5414> it on the two<WH8147> side posts<WH4201> and on the upper door post<WH4947> of the houses<WH1004>, wherein they shall eat<WH398> it.
And they shall eat<WH398> the flesh<WH1320> in that night<WH3915>, roast<WH6748> with fire<WH784>, and unleavened bread<WH4682>; and with bitter<WH4844> herbs they shall eat<WH398> it.

Eat<WH398> not of it raw<WH4995>, nor sodden<WH1310> <WH1311> at all with water<WH4325>, but roast<WH6748> with fire<WH784>; his head<WH7218> with his legs<WH3767>, and with the purtenance<WH7130> thereof.
And ye shall let nothing of it remain<WH3498> until the morning<WH1242>; and that which remaineth<WH3498> of it until the morning<WH1242> ye shall burn<WH8313> with fire<WH784>.

And thus<WH3602> shall ye eat<WH398> it; with your loins<WH4975> girded<WH2296>, your shoes<WH5275> on your feet<WH7272>, and your staff<WH4731> in your hand<WH3027>; and ye shall eat<WH398> it in haste<WH2649>: it is the LORD'S<WH3068> passover<WH6453>.

For I will pass<WH5674> through the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> this night<WH3915>, and will smite<WH5221> all the firstborn<WH1060> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, both man<WH120> and beast<WH929>; and against all the gods<WH430> of Egypt<WH4714> I will execute<WH6213> judgment<WH8201>: I am the LORD<WH3068>. gods: or, princes

And the blood<WH1818> shall be to you for a token<WH226> upon the houses<WH1004> where ye are: and when I see<WH7200> the blood<WH1818>, I will pass<WH6452> over you, and the plague<WH5063> shall not be upon you to destroy<WH4889> you, when I smite<WH5221> the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>. to destroy: Heb. for a destruction

And this day<WH3117> shall be unto you for a memorial<WH2146>; and ye shall keep<WH2287> it a feast<WH2282> to the LORD<WH3068> throughout your generations<WH1755>; ye shall keep it a feast<WH2287> by an ordinance<WH2708> for ever<WH5769>.

Seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> shall ye eat<WH398> unleavened bread<WH4682>; even<WH389> the first<WH7223> day<WH3117> ye shall put away<WH7673> leaven<WH7603> out of your houses<WH1004>: for whosoever eateth<WH398> leavened bread<WH2557> from the first<WH7223> day<WH3117> until the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117>, that soul<WH5315> shall be cut<WH3772> off from Israel<WH3478>.

And in the first<WH7223> day<WH3117> there shall be an holy<WH6944> convocation<WH4744>, and in the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> there shall be an holy<WH6944> convocation<WH4744> to you; no manner of work<WH4399> shall be done<WH6213> in them, save<WH389> that which every man<WH5315> must eat<WH398>, that only may be done<WH6213> of you. man: Heb. soul

And ye shall observe<WH8104> the feast of unleavened bread<WH4682>; for in this selfsame<WH6106> day<WH3117> have I brought<WH3318> your armies<WH6635> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>: therefore shall ye observe<WH8104> this day<WH3117> in your generations<WH1755> by an ordinance<WH2708> for ever<WH5769>.

In the first<WH7223> month, on the fourteenth<WH6240> <WH702> day<WH3117> of the month<WH2320> at even<WH6153>, ye shall eat<WH398> unleavened bread<WH4682>, until the one<WH259> and twentieth<WH6242> day<WH3117> of the month<WH2320> at even<WH6153>.

Seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> shall there be no leaven<WH7603> found<WH4672> in your houses<WH1004>: for whosoever eateth<WH398> that which is leavened<WH2556>, even that soul<WH5315> shall be cut off<WH3772> from the congregation<WH5712> of Israel<WH3478>, whether he be a stranger<WH1616>, or born<WH249> in the land<WH776>.
Ye shall eat<WH398> nothing leavened<WH2556>; in all your habitations<WH4186> shall ye eat<WH398> unleavened bread<WH4682>.

Then Moses<WH4872> called<WH7121> for all the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478>, and said<WH559> unto them, Draw out<WH4900> and take<WH3947> you a lamb<WH6629> according to your families<WH4940>, and kill<WH7819> the passover<WH6453>. lamb: or, kid

And ye shall take<WH3947> a bunch<WH92> of hyssop<WH231>, and dip<WH2881> it in the blood<WH1818> that is in the bason<WH5592>, and strike<WH5060> the lintel<WH4947> and the two<WH8147> side posts<WH4201> with the blood<WH1818> that is in the bason<WH5592>; and none<WH376> of you shall go out<WH3318> at the door<WH6607> of his house<WH1004> until the morning<WH1242>.

For the LORD<WH3068> will pass through<WH5674> to smite<WH5062> the Egyptians<WH4714>; and when he seeth<WH7200> the blood<WH1818> upon the lintel<WH4947>, and on the two<WH8147> side posts<WH4201>, the LORD<WH3068> will pass over<WH6452> the door<WH6607>, and will not suffer<WH5414> the destroyer<WH7843> to come<WH935> in unto your houses<WH1004> to smite<WH5062> you.
And ye shall observe<WH8104> this thing<WH1697> for an ordinance<WH2706> to thee and to thy sons<WH1121> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>.

And it shall come to pass, when ye be come<WH935> to the land<WH776> which the LORD<WH3068> will give<WH5414> you, according as he hath promised<WH1696>, that ye shall keep<WH8104> this service<WH5656>.
And it shall come to pass, when your children<WH1121> shall say<WH559> unto you, What mean ye by this service<WH5656>?

That ye shall say<WH559>, It is the sacrifice<WH2077> of the LORD'S<WH3068> passover<WH6453>, who passed<WH6452> over the houses<WH1004> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> in Egypt<WH4714>, when he smote<WH5062> the Egyptians<WH4714>, and delivered<WH5337> our houses<WH1004>. And the people<WH5971> bowed the head<WH6915> and worshipped<WH7812>.
And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> went away<WH3212>, and did<WH6213> as the LORD<WH3068> had commanded<WH6680> Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175>, so did<WH6213> they.

And it came to pass, that at midnight<WH2677> <WH3915> the LORD<WH3068> smote<WH5221> all the firstborn<WH1060> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, from the firstborn<WH1060> of Pharaoh<WH6547> that sat<WH3427> on his throne<WH3678> unto the firstborn<WH1060> of the captive<WH7628> that was in the dungeon<WH1004> <WH953>; and all the firstborn<WH1060> of cattle<WH929>. dungeon: Heb. house of the pit

And Pharaoh<WH6547> rose up<WH6965> in the night<WH3915>, he, and all his servants<WH5650>, and all the Egyptians<WH4714>; and there was a great<WH1419> cry<WH6818> in Egypt<WH4714>; for there was not a house<WH1004> where there was not one dead<WH4191>.

And he called<WH7121> for Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> by night<WH3915>, and said<WH559>, Rise up<WH6965>, and get you forth<WH3318> from among<WH8432> my people<WH5971>, both ye and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>; and go<WH3212>, serve<WH5647> the LORD<WH3068>, as ye have said<WH1696>.
Also take<WH3947> your flocks<WH6629> and your herds<WH1241>, as ye have said<WH1696>, and be gone<WH3212>; and bless<WH1288> me also.
And the Egyptians<WH4714> were urgent<WH2388> upon the people<WH5971>, that they might send<WH7971> them out of the land<WH776> in haste<WH4116>; for they said<WH559>, We be all dead<WH4191> men.

And the people<WH5971> took<WH5375> their dough<WH1217> before it was leavened<WH2556>, their kneadingtroughs<WH4863> being bound up<WH6887> in their clothes<WH8071> upon their shoulders<WH7926>. kneadingtroughs: or, dough

And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> did<WH6213> according to the word<WH1697> of Moses<WH4872>; and they borrowed<WH7592> of the Egyptians<WH4714> jewels<WH3627> of silver<WH3701>, and jewels<WH3627> of gold<WH2091>, and raiment<WH8071>:

And the LORD<WH3068> gave<WH5414> the people<WH5971> favour<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of the Egyptians<WH4714>, so that they lent<WH7592> unto them such things as they required. And they spoiled<WH5337> the Egyptians<WH4714>.

And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> journeyed<WH5265> from Rameses<WH7486> to Succoth<WH5523>, about six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> thousand<WH505> on foot<WH7273> that were men<WH1397>, beside<WH905> children<WH2945>.
And a mixed<WH6154> multitude<WH7227> went up<WH5927> also with them; and flocks<WH6629>, and herds<WH1241>, even very<WH3966> much<WH3515> cattle<WH4735>. a mixed: Heb. a great mixture

And they baked<WH644> unleavened<WH4682> cakes<WH5692> of the dough<WH1217> which they brought forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714>, for it was not leavened<WH2556>; because they were thrust out<WH1644> of Egypt<WH4714>, and could<WH3201> not tarry<WH4102>, neither had they prepared<WH6213> for themselves any victual<WH6720>.
Now the sojourning<WH4186> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, who dwelt<WH3427> in Egypt<WH4714>, was four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> <WH8141> and thirty<WH7970> years<WH8141>.

And it came to pass at the end<WH7093> of the four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> <WH8141> and thirty<WH7970> years<WH8141>, even the selfsame<WH6106> day<WH3117> it came to pass, that all the hosts<WH6635> of the LORD<WH3068> went out<WH3318> from the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.

It is a night<WH3915> to be much observed<WH8107> unto the LORD<WH3068> for bringing<WH3318> them out from the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>: this is that night<WH3915> of the LORD<WH3068> to be observed<WH8107> of all the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> in their generations<WH1755>. a night: Heb. a night of observations
And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175>, This is the ordinance<WH2708> of the passover<WH6453>: There shall no stranger<WH1121> <WH5236> eat<WH398> thereof:
But every man's<WH376> servant<WH5650> that is bought<WH4736> for money<WH3701>, when thou hast circumcised<WH4135> him, then shall he eat<WH398> thereof.
A foreigner<WH8453> and an hired servant<WH7916> shall not eat<WH398> thereof.

In one<WH259> house<WH1004> shall it be eaten<WH398>; thou shalt not carry forth<WH3318> ought of the flesh<WH1320> abroad<WH2351> out of the house<WH1004>; neither shall ye break<WH7665> a bone<WH6106> thereof.
All the congregation<WH5712> of Israel<WH3478> shall keep<WH6213> it. keep: Heb. do it

And when a stranger<WH1616> shall sojourn<WH1481> with thee, and will keep<WH6213> the passover<WH6453> to the LORD<WH3068>, let all his males<WH2145> be circumcised<WH4135>, and then let him come near<WH7126> and keep<WH6213> it; and he shall be as one that is born<WH249> in the land<WH776>: for no uncircumcised person<WH6189> shall eat<WH398> thereof.
One<WH259> law<WH8451> shall be to him that is homeborn<WH249>, and unto the stranger<WH1616> that sojourneth<WH1481> among<WH8432> you.
Thus did<WH6213> all the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>; as the LORD<WH3068> commanded<WH6680> Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175>, so did<WH6213> they.
And it came to pass the selfsame<WH6106> day<WH3117>, that the LORD<WH3068> did bring<WH3318> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> by their armies<WH6635>.
